scenes
Class AbstractGUIScene

java.lang.Object
  org.mt4j.sceneManagement.AbstractScene
      scenes.AbstractGUIScene
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.mt4j.sceneManagement.Iscene
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractLoadScene, HomeScene, PointTestScene, Rotation3DScene, SceneX2
public abstract class AbstractGUIScene
extends org.mt4j.sceneManagement.AbstractScene

This class represents the base class for all GUI-scenes in the 3D-GUI context. It defines a common look and feel and provides simple keyboard handling. It also augments the standard scene interface with some Helper-function, which are pretty messed up in MT4j.

Version:
20110930
Author:
langenhagen

getComponentByName

public org.mt4j.components.MTComponent getComponentByName(java.lang.String name)
Gets a child of the canvas of this scene by its name. Not like the getCanvas().getChildByName()-method, this method looks in the scenegraph recursively, giving you the freedom you need to find items in a bigger scene graph-hierarchy.

Parameters:
name - The name of the component as a String.
Returns:
The (maybe indirect) child of the canvas with the specified name as an MTComponent.

keyEvent

public void keyEvent(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
Manages the keyboard input, mainly for debugging reasons.

Parameters:
e - The KeyEvent that happened.

At the moment, following keys commands can be used:
F - console output framerate
+ - zoom in
- - zoom out
Arrow keys - move cam
R - reset camera postition to initial one
F12 - make screenshot
Q - quit application
